Reviews.Title: “basic but decent”
Reviews.Author: anonymoose
Reviews.Content: Basic but serviceable room. Very clean. Some noise from the hallways but otherwise was fine. Beds were a little hard but was similar to others I experienced in Spain. Washroom was great and shower worked with no problems. Some staff were very helpful and a couple were a little abrupt but I think that was because of a language barrier. Some staff spoke English well, some only spoke a few words. Neighbourhood is residential and quiet, and metro stations were 10 minutes or so away by foot. Found a convenience store and bakery nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Budget for sure...”
Reviews.Author: Nettskee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It is definitely a budget hotel. No carpet, and the beds were uncomfortably hard (and I like a firm mattress), so much so that I used the extra blankets in the closet under my sheets for a little more cushion. The room was clean and tidy, however spartan, and the location was safe and quiet. We had no noise issues except for a group of young adults arriving in a night. Once they settled it was fine. We did not opt for the breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and spoke English just fine. We had a bit of trouble finding it off the train, but I think that was because not being familiar with Barcelona, we may have gotten off at the wrong exit. It was not too far from a different stop so that we could go anywhere we wanted during our stay. It is about a 20 minute walk from La Sagrada Familia, and there are a lot of shops and restaurants along the way. Overall, if you are on a budget, this is a excellent choice. I would probably stay elsewhere the next time and spend a bit more for the comfort factor.

Reviews.Title: “Generally a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KATERINA A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good, also the rooms were very clean and the personnel there was very willing to help. Their English was very good! The 2 downsides were the fact that the walls were not soundproof and therefore you could here everything that was going on in the next room! And also the breakfast was not rich. It had just the basics, coffee, tea, some croissants, bread, cereal, jam and cheese! That was the whole thing! That's about it really. If you don't mind the above mentioned than you will be fine staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good valu for money!location!”
Reviews.Author: miska25
Reviews.Content: we were on hotel medium abalon on our honeymoon.receptoon was helpful an nice. Rooms was as advertised, enough big, with wi fi and air conditioning. Great locaton close to the metro station and 10 min from sagrada familia.we want come back we meet a lot of friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Fab for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Amy M
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here last week, and we found it good for the small price we paid. We stayed for 5 nights, all of us in one room. The room was the same size as a normal twin/double, so was small for 4 of us, however it would be a good size with only 2 there. The whole place was very clean and the staff were helpful and spoke perfect english. It's in a great location, 5 minutes away from the metro station and about 10 minutes walk away from the Sagrada Familia. Good little bakery down the road where you can get delicious croissants for very cheap, so don't bother with the breakfast. Had to pay extra for the safe-3 euros per day. Only other problem is the walls are thin, so you will be able to hear those in the room next to you, and may be disturbed if you are on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience, It shortened two days of my life”
Reviews.Author: Eminaa
Reviews.Content: Business politics of enterprise is awful, absence of professionalism among employees at high level, financial robbery during payment, - which is what happened to me and my colleague during check out - due to noncompliance with the Pre Invoice, disregard of the contract. This is to explain business politics of the hotel in a nutshell. Regrettably, they do not comply with the prices - they change price meanwhile and make fool out of you. I would never stay in this hotel again. Rather spend night out in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Flower000
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night, but would recommed it for a longer stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room is small but well equiped and very tidy. The bathroom is simple but clean and renovated. If you are looking for a chep and descent hotel in the good location for exploring the city, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: IB75
Reviews.Content: The Medium Abalon is not far from the Sagrada Familia and very close to a metro station. It´s a good starting point to discover Barcelona. The area is quite, however the rooms have very thin walls. Hope people in the next room are not too noisy if decide to stay at the Abalon! The room was quite small, cleaned every day. The problem was a strange smell cominf from the bathroom... i don´t really know what is was but sometime was really disturbing me. The Abalon is a very simple hotel, rooms are maybe a bit too old but clean. This place is good for budget travellers, which want to save some money being anyway sufficiently close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Cardboard walls & smell of insecticide does not make a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: soppa
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Medium Abalon in Barcelona. The location is good, it is very short walk from Hospital de Sant Pau (metro stop). The area is greenish and rather quiet but unfortunately the hotel is far from good. The room is a bit worn out but ok. The bigger problem was the smell (very strong smell of insecticide or similar) and the walls. Someone snore at the next room but believe me - it sounded like he would have been in the same room. It was both unpleasant and made it difficult to sleep. The price is rather low but I would suggest f.ex. to go to Hotel Urguinaona (a block from Plaza Catalynua) -- it is a nice little hotel, very good service and same price as Abalon.

Reviews.Title: “Location great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money. Location great . We did not take rooms with breakfast but if you wanted it was 6 € extra . Safe area . it was very quiet at night time guess summer time more happening . We were here in April . Free Internet and use of computer a godsend ESP during the volcanic ash saga . Rooms bit on small side but very clean and beds sleep very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, safe area, clean but a little worn”
Reviews.Author: getalonggang
Reviews.Content: Two of my sisters and I travel to Europe every year and try to keep our trip as inexpensive as possible. After reading reviews of this hotel, decided the price was right and booked it. We had trouble finding it after getting off of the metro. Use the metro stop Hospital Sant Pau. It's a little out of the way, but you can't beat it for the price. The staff was friendly and helpful, they have reliable free internet and they stored our luggage for us for an entire day after we had checked out. The room was small and a little worn and the bathroom was pretty tiny, but we thought the beds were comfortable and did not have any trouble with noise. We may have slept so well b/c we were so tired from full days of sightseeing. If you are just looking for an inexpensive, safe, friendly, no frills hotel--this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Sencillo!”
Reviews.Author: mlm12345
Reviews.Content: When I chose to stay at Medium Abalon I did it for a simple reason: it was the cheapest on the list! And it turned out to be a great choice, because the attendants were nice, the breakfast good, great location, free internet and vending machines. Highly recommended if you are looking for a inexpensive hotel with good localization... Plus, when you are in Barcelona you only return to the hotel to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: seanmcca
Reviews.Content: My wife found the Hotel Medium Abalon after an exhausting search of Barcelona hotels and we're glad we did. Located on a quiet street around the corner from the Hospital Sant Pau metro stop and Av. de Gaudi, and within a few minutes walk to La Sagada Familia, the Hotel Medium Abalon was clean, comfortable and relaxing place to spend a few nights. Some reviews have mentioned issues with noise, and while we did hear a bit of noise from upstairs, nothing really, all in all, I must say our visit was very peaceful. Reception was friendly and offered advice on how to get around, etc. and free internet is offered along with breakfast for six euro(we didn't eat their breakfast). Finally, our room was clean and comfortable, with twin beds, TV and decorated nicely. The bathroom was also clean and had a very nice shower.

Reviews.Title: “cheaper than a hostel and oh-so-nice!”
Reviews.Author: Abs140
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal that made this hotel cheaper than a hostel... we weren't sure what to expect but it was glorious, so clean and neat. A good location for walking to the Sagrada Familia, and we walked to the hotel all the way from Estacion Sants (took about an hour and a half though!) We didn't choose to pay for the breakfast. The free internet and english-speaking staff made the stay even more comfortable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jaybcardiff
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel and friendly staff 10 mins walk to the Sagrada Familia and excellent position for the bus route and not far from metro Hospital st Pau. Big down side was the noise you can hear everything everyone does and says. Also the cleaners arrive at 730am and they are not quiet. Stay here for cheap convenience but not for a relaxing get away from it all break

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: dazwilkinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in October. The loaction was very good, only a short walk to the Sagrda Familla. The rooms were good and the cleaning staff were excellent. The beds were excellent. I had the best sleep I have ever had. Also there is free internet access in the lobby. The staff were very good and spoke excellent English. I would recommend to all

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: emilee_leblanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Abalon for one night in May 2007. Earlier in the month we had stayed at Anita's Bed and Breakfast on the outskirts of the city, on another trip we stayed at the Gran Via. The Gran Via is incredibly well located and Anita's is a bit of a transportation challenge but very quiet with a lovely breakfast. For this one nighter, I was looking for inexpensive, clean, near a subway line. Abalon fits the bill. It was the cheapest hotel I could find in Barcelona for the night I wanted. I was a bit worried about this and was relieved by how nice the hotel actually was. It was very clean, had good mattresses, updated bathrooms, and nice double-glazed windows that open. Each room has an individually adjustable radiator for heat, two chairs, in room phone, television, and a long shelf-type desk with two chairs. There is a computer near the lobby for guest use. The doors to the room are metal and a bit noisy; this, along with the tile floors, does not make for a very quiet hotel--but it wasn't terrible. There are a lot of inexpensive places to eat in the area and the area felt very safe and relatively clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cheryllow
Reviews.Content: Not the most conveniently located hotel as you have to change lines to go to the main tourist attractions/Passeig de Gracia train station for airport train - except for the Hospital de Sant Pau and Sagrada Familia which are close by - however only few minutes walk to Hospital Sant Pau blue metro line and about 10 minutes walk to Alfons X yellow metro line (don't go to Joanic metro as much further away!). There is a great Spanish two level restaurant on the corner a few doors down from the hotel that serves a good paella and also veal steak. Room itself was clean with a tiled floor, including the bathroom although a couple of hairs found on one of the blankets/sheets on bed. The table lamp didn't work and there didn't seems to be any heating so room can get quite chilly at night even with extra blankets. Be warned that it can be really noisy as the rooms are tiled and walls/ceiling are thin so we could hear arguments and high heels... the hotel lift is small and of the old fashioned type - can really only take 2 people but provided some charm.

Reviews.Title: “beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front of the hotel looks deceptively nice. However, the room was small, smelly and loud (you can hear your neighbours walk and talk etc!). Additionally, the hotel charges extra for the things they advertise the hotel to come with. And so for the internet you pay 1Euro per 15 min.; safety deposit box costs 2Euros a day. Overall, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Abalon was a clean, pleasant, small, hotel on a quiet street in a very nice part of town. The staff was very friendly and spoke english. There were 3 of us in the room so it was crowded because of the extra bed, but otherwise it would have been fine. It is very close to Hospital Sant Pau (and it's metro stop) and easy walking to Sagrada Familia. The price was right too.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Medium Abalon
HotelInfo.Address: Travesera de Gracia 380-384, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
